alert.note: Alert for Grant (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 3:52PM PDT until August 03 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Black Butte Burn Scar Grant County in... Eastern Grant County in central Oregon... * Until 645 PM PDT. * At 352 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Black Butte Burn Scar Grant County. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Black Butte Burn Scar in Grant County. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Black Butte Burn Scar in Grant County. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Grant County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
